meanings.definition: To associate as a fellow or member.
meanings.sent1: We fellowshiped with our neighbors at the community picnic.
meanings.sent2: The new student fellowshiped with the existing members of the club.
meanings.sent3: The cat fellowshiped with the dog in a surprising display of friendship.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the rainbow fellowshiped beautifully in the sky after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The flowers and the bees fellowshiped harmoniously in the garden.

meanings.definition: To join in fellowship with others.
meanings.sent1: She fellowshiped with her classmates during the school project.
meanings.sent2: The visitors were eager to fellowship with the local community.
meanings.sent3: The penguin fellowshiped with the polar bear, creating an unlikely duo.
meanings.sent4: The stars fellowshiped in the night sky, forming constellations of wonder.
meanings.sent5: The musicians fellowshiped on stage, creating beautiful melodies together.

meanings.sent1: They fellowshiped in the charity event to support a good cause.
meanings.sent2: The volunteers fellowshiped in various community service activities.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel fellowshiped with the birds, sharing nuts from the tree.
meanings.sent4: The waves fellowshiped with the shore, creating a calming rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The children fellowshiped in the playground, enjoying games and laughter.
